summary: Superstar rap mogul C-Note (Antwan "Big Boi" Patton) wants to join the Carolina Pines Golf & Country Club, but faces stiff opposition from the establishment's snooty members. C-Note forces the issue by purchasing the land adjacent to the golf course's 17th hole. As the club leaders search for a way to revoke his membership, C-Note realizes his family's honor and golf history are at stake, and digs in for the fight of his life.

reviews.content: The end of Love Story was funnier.

Frivolously inept prompt of agreeably ripping off "Caddyshack" with immaturely juvenile execution that decreases uninterestingly due to generational shame being stereotypically driven, whilst only shot few rare humorous bits. (C-)

I am convinced that this movie started life as "Caddyshack 3" but after "Caddyshack II" failed at the box office, it sat on a shelf until 2000s where it was tweaked and reworked as this.  Big Boi does a great job as our protagonist.  Some of the other characters can be really annoying and there are some gross out jokes I think we could have passed on.  Also, I wish this could have done better if it went the full R like Caddyshack and not PG-13.  Rappers work better in stories that don't have the restrictions of one f-bombs and no nudity.  But it's still fairly good.
Ages 13+ only; funny and romantic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I watched this after hearing that it was Bill Clinton's favorite comedy movie. It should be pointed out that Bill watched this on an airplane to Thailand, so he may have been suffering a bit of jetlag. But, all in all, the film exceeded my expectations, based on the reviews I'd seen. It's not going to win any awards, but as hip-hop golf comedies with registered sex offenders in supporting roles go, it's not all that bad.

I have a hard time sitting through all bad movies, but I hold a special place in my heart for bad comedies. Nothing seems to suck the life out of me like a laughless, lifeless comedy which is why I sort of had a fondness for "Who's Your Caddy?". I can't quite recommend it, but considering my mood going into the picture, the fact that I came this close to recommending it simply astonished me.
The movie is an obvious retread of that untouchable classic "Caddyshack", and while it never approaches greatness like that picture, it is buoyant and likable most of the way. There are some crude moments, but the movie wisely keeps its boundaries. That's rare for a movie such as this.
Outkast rapper Big Boi is surprisingly enjoyable in the lead role, and he has surrounded himself with a cast that appears game for anything. Even disgraced actor Jeffrey Jones is decent in the throwaway role of the perpetually foiled bad guy much like his character in "Ferris Bueller". 
A little push and some ambition and they really could have had something here. I laughed a few times, and smiled a lot. Just not enough for me to whole-heartedly get behind "Who's Your Caddy?". Still, if you saw me heading into the theater you would have thought I was going to my own execution. There's a pulse here, and some promise that is only marginally realized.
It has everything it needs to be a good film,but adds too many jokes that are just not funny.
It's juvenile, ribald, ignorant, and the ending will make you think "Yeah right!" It can't decide wheter it wants to be a low-brow farce or a cliched sports drama with a racial undertone.

This movie could easily have been filmed during the heyday of the blaxploitation films of the 70's.  Everything about it is stereotypical.  The black people are loud, jovial, and over-sized.  The white people are stuck-up and repressed, except for the one white guy who is so cool that he hangs out with the black caddies, and, of course, the white women unable to withstand the seething heat of a brother's charm.  Gee whiz.  I am almost embarrassed to have watched this thing and laughed any at all, but I did.

Caddyshack got a much needed reworking in this film. I had grown tired of that boring and unsatisfying "comedy" of sorts. This is a refreshing new direction for modern film and I believe this is the beginning of a prosperous film career for Big Boi. The polo scenes were exhilarating to say the least. The story touched me deeply, with the final scene leaving me in tears. It is a great step in illuminating racism in our society, revealing that people of all cultural backgrounds can enjoy the thrill of golf. Truly, it has been years since a film has come along with such cultural impact. Bravo.

Wow. I went to the video store tonight because I was in the mood for a bad B Horror movie and I found this Gem. I looked at the cover and I thought it looked like just the movie for my mood. I brought it home and put it on.

This movie was not the B Horror movie that I had in mind. This was MUCH worse. I wanted a bad movie but what I got, I didn't know that crap like this existed amongst man. This movie seemed like a 5 year old wrote and directed it and that is being nice about it.

I am an aspiring director and this movie made me so mad that someone out there is actually paying this guy to direct movies. He needs to work at a garbage dump shoveling crap where he belongs.

If you are thinking about renting this or buying it. I will tell you the same thing that I would tell someone getting ready to commit suicide. "DON'T DO IT, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!" I really have nothing nice to say about this movie. DON'T DO IT!

Superstar rap mogul C-Note runs into fierce opposition when he tries to join the super stuffy Carolina Pines Golf & Country Club. Undeterred, C-Note gets the brilliant idea to buy the land adjacent to the golf club's 17th hole, which he cleverly leverages to gain membership.

This movie has no redeeming qualities. There is no logical plot whatsoever and the direction that this movie goes into is just wrong.  It seems that all black comedies use the idea of "get back at whitey" to draw some laughs.  Well, Don Michael Paul, it doesn't work. This is also one of the most racist movies out there.  I am very surprised I didn't see C-Note and the gang eat some fried chicken with a side of watermelon.  It also reinforced white stereotypes too.  I love how the black people in this movie think that "the man" is putting them down because C-Note pushes his way into an exclusive club, in which their is a six year waiting period, demanding admittance and when the white man doesn't let him in he's being racist. NO, there's a waiting period you jackass.  My favorite line of the movie is when the white man calls one of his "posse" a moron and he says "Did he just call me a nigga?" NO he called you a moron listen up next time.   This movie single handed sets black people back 100 years. The only movie worse than this is Battlefield Earth.
pretty funny movie, some parts were dull but some had me totally falling out of my chair.
rascist but funn as hell

What in the name of Christ did I do to deserve such unbearable torture? Not only is this the worst film of 2007, but also possibly the worst film ever made in the history of cinema. Pain inducingly appalling, with laughs as common as a decent Uwe Boll movie, and about as funny as the Holocaust! The film runs for about 90 minutes...and that's pretty much 90 minutes TOO LONG! A rap mogul attempts to join a country golf club with opposition from the club's president (Jones). But he gets his membership and his war with the club president continues. That's the only evidence of a plot that emerged here, in this agonizingly terrible movie that is like having an eye enema! The script is as painful as falling into a pit of razorblades, and not even taking hallucinogenics would make this film seem good! It's as bad as Hitler's decision to initiate the Holocaust! I would rather jump off a cliff into jagged rocks than watch this movie again! It's a bigger mistake than making George W. Bush the President of the United States! It's predictable, uncreative, terribly plotted, filled with filthy sexual humour and even resorts to using pathetic flatulence gags! Poorly scripted, poorly filmed, poorly acted, poorly edited. Avoid it like the plague!!!!

Who's Your Caddy holds a special place in my heart.  It and Dreamcatcher have the privelege of being the only two movies I've ever walked out on.  When you go to see a comedy and feel like your in a tomb of dead silence, there is a damn problem.  My friend took multiple smoke breaks.  I sat out the first 45 minutes without interruption.  I haven't been the same sense.  It may also contain the most disturbing fart joke that I've ever seen in movie history.
Funny at times.  Good Story.  Nice movie.

I had to wait for one hour until I laughed for the first time, and this is supposed to be a comedy? Don't waste your time!

C-Note Played By Big Boi is a famous rapper who tries to get into this golf membership but gets turned out for numerous stupid reasons. He tries to bribe but it doesn't work. he decides to buy the estate right next door to get on the owner's nerves,who has a lot of prejudice against black people. He tries everything to keep him out from accepting him to then try to revoke his membership to even order a hit to get him out of his hair. Will he succeed?

Will win the Best Picture Oscar, hands down. A sophisticated portrait of competition and the emotional scars one gains and suffers from conflict. A thoroughly engrossing and illuminative piece of film. Ranks among the top ten movies of the decade, if not the century. A meditation on the horror of losing, or even at times, winning. This will be remembered for years to come. The theatre applauded nonstop for thirty minutes after the credits rolled. A+. 10 stars. The absolute finest that cinema has to offer these days or any day.

I'm really getting tired of these movies villainizing white people and trying to fabricate racial issues where none exist. Yes, country clubs are mostly white, and that's because mostly white people like golf. Do you think you see Snoop Doggy Dogg watching the Golf Channel? No! 

Now let's forget that this movie is probably the most racist piece of trash I've ever seen, and just focus on it as a movie.

It sucks.

Look, when even my friend who I saw the movie with, who is black, dresses in those cool doo-raggy thingies, and laughs at anything in the audience with me is giving the screen that "wtf?" look at what are supposed to be jokes, you know this movie sucks. Everything even remotely funny is in the previews. In fact, it makes bold attempts at being...I don't know...cute. It feels like a kids movie, it really, really does, some family-oriented adventure about getting into a country club. But then you throw in the numerous references to "hoes" and completely idiotic overexagerations of what is 'gangster.' For example there's a pimped-out golf cart (complete with 'spinners') that's introduced during a stupid rap melody in slow motion. The director obviously did this as a cheap sight gag, but the only thing I heard from the people beside me was "that's retarded." Well said. In fact, that might be the best way to review this movie, being short and simple: retarded.

When I started doing these reviews, I wondered when I would meet that movie that got the lowest possible rating, that movie that really didn't have a single saving grace; here it is.  It's a shame I can't give it zero stars.  Racism abounds, except this time, none of it is funny.  It's unoriginal to the point that it's a tragedy, and I can't really think of anybody that I would recommend this movie to.  Simply disgusting.
